topic: How to profile WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to profile WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Profiling WebAssembly (WASM) Targets Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides an overview on how to use FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs in Python, along with Python 3.12+'s enhanced support for WebAssembly (WASM), to profile WASM targets.
key_points: Implement the FastAPI endpoint for profiling
Write WASM module using Python 3.12+'s WASI-compliant WebAssembly support
Register and execute the WASM module in FastAPI

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, HTTPException
app = FastAPI()
...

def run_wasm(module: bytes):
   # Execution of WASM module code here ...

version_notes: Python 3.12+'s enhanced WebAssembly support allows easier integration with FastAPI for profiling WASM targets
Uvicorn, a modern ASGI server, is recommended to run the FastAPI application
caveats: Ensure your Python environment has the required dependencies installed
Properly set up the development and production environments for optimal performance
The guide focuses on basic profiling; further optimizations may be needed for production-level WASM target profiling
